lexUnit.name: strip.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: remove of accessories or fittings

sentence.text: By the beginning of the eighteenth century they had stripped Ireland bare of her forests .
The refugees have stripped the surrounding hills almost bare , and spend much of their time collecting branches .
They did n't strip you naked .
The refugees have stripped the surrounding hills almost bare , and spend much of their time collecting branches .
Using the wealth of material produced by Haringey Council to explain the whys and wherefores of lesbian and gay equality , Mr Grant stripped the new Clause bare of any respectable pretensions .
On instructions from the Corporals , we stripped him naked and made him run across to the horse trough where he was thrown in .
She had no wish to strip herself bare for his amusement .
But burglars forced a kitchen window while she was out and stripped the house of everything valuable .
Regulars at the Foresters Arm , Coatham Mundeville , looked on in astonishment last year when bailiffs came in and stripped the pub of furniture and fittings .
He realized that a robot was stripping him of his armour and removing all detectable weapons .
FIRST thieves stripped their room of luggage , clothes , money , passports and tickets within hours of their arrival in Orlando , Florida .
Thieves , having stolen a car , take it for a joy ride and then strip it before setting it alight to destroy the evidence .
She turned away to strip the rumpled bed , then straightened the room and packed her few belongings in her bag , feeling more reluctant by the minute to face Penry in the cold light of day .
In September 1907 he was stripped of the captaincy and fined £10 for drunkenness and violent behaviour and in 1910 transferred for a measly £100 to Woolwich Arsenal .
The new government stripped the Tokugawa family of most of its land and Keiki was forced to resign its headship ; many Bakufu supporters also lost their domains .
Now , in the sudden silence , Tug felt as though he had been stripped naked and pushed out into a football crowd .
For some time , the mill stood idle and decaying , but was eventually stripped of its machinery and converted to two cottages .
All the graves are in very bad condition -- weed-choked , and stripped of whatever marble and railings could be removed .
In August 1536 he was condemned as a heretic , publicly stripped of the vestments of priesthood , and handed over to the secular authorities .
